DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to represent the name of the arterial embolization or radioembolization agent utilized in the embolization therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: (EM-bo-lih-ZAY-shun) The blocking of an artery by a clot or foreign material. Embolization can be done as treatment to block the flow of blood to a tumor._An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI)_Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (EM-bo-lih-ZAY-shun) The blocking of an artery by a clot or foreign material. Embolization can be done as treatment to block the flow of blood to a tumor.:An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: A procedure in which substances are injected into blood vessels adjacent to a tumor for the purpose of interrupting the blood flow to the cancer cells.
An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.

Property.preferredDefinition: Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.

Concepts.definition: A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for TCGA per request by T.Lichtenberg. mc 6/23/11 Released per approval from Tara. mc 6/30/11

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A substance used to block an artery, thereby eliminating the blood flow to a specific part of an organ.  An embolic agent may cause permanent or temporary blockage depending on the nature of the material used._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An embolic bead that is made from plastic-like resin or polymer.

Concepts.definition: An embolic bead that is made from a plastic-like resin or polymer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An injectable formulation of the radioisotope yttrium Y 90 encapsulated in resin microspheres with potential antineoplastic activity. When injected into arterial vasculature supplying the tumor, yttrium Y 90 resin microspheres occlude tumor blood vessels and selectively deliver a cytotoxic dose of beta emitting yttrium Y 90 to the tumor site, which may result in tumor cell death and tumor regression.

Concepts.definition: An injectable formulation of the radioisotope yttrium Y 90 encapsulated in resin microspheres with potential antineoplastic activity. When injected into arterial vasculature supplying the tumor, yttrium Y 90 resin microspheres occlude tumor blood vessels and selectively deliver a cytotoxic dose of beta emitting yttrium Y 90 to the tumor site, which may result in tumor cell death and tumor regression.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An injectable formulation of yttrium Y 90 consisting of glass microspheres containing the radioisotope yttrium Y 90.  When injected into the tumor vascular bed, yttrium Y 90 glass microspheres occlude tumor blood vessels and deliver a cytotoxic dose of beta radiation to the tumor site, thereby reducing the tumor burden. (NCI04)

Concepts.definition: An injectable formulation of yttrium Y 90 consisting of glass microspheres containing the radioisotope yttrium Y 90.  When injected into the tumor vascular bed, yttrium Y 90 glass microspheres occlude tumor blood vessels and deliver a cytotoxic dose of beta radiation to the tumor site, thereby reducing the tumor burden. (NCI04)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A sterile hemostatic agent composed of purified porcine-derived gelatin.  In regional chemotherapy, absorbable gelatin sponge may be used to embolize arteries in the region of a tumor in order to block or retard blood flow; this blockage results in a locally increased concentration of chemotherapeutic agents delivered to the tumor when chemotherapeutic agents are infused into the embolized arterial circulation upstream of the blockage.

Concepts.definition: A sterile hemostatic agent composed of purified porcine-derived gelatin.  In regional chemotherapy, absorbable gelatin sponge may be used to embolize arteries in the region of a tumor in order to block or retard blood flow; this blockage results in a locally increased concentration of chemotherapeutic agents delivered to the tumor when chemotherapeutic agents are infused into the embolized arterial circulation upstream of the blockage.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A substance used to block an artery, thereby eliminating the blood flow to a specific part of an organ.  An embolic agent may cause permanent or temporary blockage depending on the nature of the material used.:The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: A substance used to block an artery, thereby eliminating the blood flow to a specific part of an organ. An embolic agent may cause permanent or temporary blockage depending on the nature of the material used.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.
